meta.title: Dark Patterns: Unveiling Manipulation
meta.tagline: Exposing the Subtle Art of Influence in Digital & Human Realms

forced-continuity.name: Forced Continuity
forced-continuity.description: When free trials automatically convert to paid subscriptions without clear warning or easy cancellation.
forced-continuity.how_to_spot: Look for vague trial terms or difficult cancellation flows, especially after a 'free' period ends.
forced-continuity.user_impact: Users are often charged unexpectedly, leading to frustration and financial loss.

confirmshaming.name: Confirmshaming
confirmshaming.description: Guilting users into opting into something by shaming them if they decline, often through negative phrasing.
confirmshaming.how_to_spot: Phrases like 'No thanks, I prefer to pay full price' or 'I don't care about saving money' when declining an offer.
confirmshaming.user_impact: Creates emotional pressure, leading users to make choices they might not genuinely want.

roach-motel.name: Roach Motel
roach-motel.description: Making it easy to get into a situation (e.g., signing up) but hard to get out of it (e.g., cancelling a subscription).
roach-motel.how_to_spot: Simple sign-up processes contrasted with convoluted, multi-step cancellation procedures or hidden links.
roach-motel.user_impact: Traps users in services they no longer want, causing frustration and wasted time/money.

bait-switch.name: Bait & Switch
bait-switch.description: Advertising one thing (the 'bait') but delivering another, less desirable thing (the 'switch') after the user commits.
bait-switch.how_to_spot: Significant discrepancies between advertised features/prices and the actual product/service received after purchase or sign-up.
bait-switch.user_impact: Leads to disappointment, distrust, and feeling deceived after committing resources.

hidden-costs.name: Hidden Costs
hidden-costs.description: Revealing additional fees, taxes, or charges only at the final stages of a transaction, after the user has invested time.
hidden-costs.how_to_spot: Prices that unexpectedly increase significantly at checkout, often with vague explanations for the added fees.
hidden-costs.user_impact: Creates a sense of commitment (sunk cost) making users more likely to accept the higher price to avoid abandoning the process.

privacy-zuckering.name: Privacy Zuckering
privacy-zuckering.description: Tricking users into sharing more personal information than they intend or realize, often through confusing privacy settings.
privacy-zuckering.how_to_spot: Default opt-ins for data sharing, complex privacy menus, or unclear language about data usage.
privacy-zuckering.user_impact: Compromises user privacy, leading to unwanted data collection and targeted advertising.

autoplay-next.name: Autoplay Next Episode
autoplay-next.description: Automatically playing the next episode to keep users engaged for longer periods.
autoplay-next.how_to_spot: Content starts playing without explicit user action, often with a short countdown.
autoplay-next.user_impact: Can lead to binge-watching and excessive screen time, making it harder to disengage.

countdown-timer.name: Countdown Timer
countdown-timer.description: Creating urgency with 'leaving soon' notifications for content or limited-time offers.
countdown-timer.how_to_spot: Visible timers indicating content expiration or deal deadlines, pressuring immediate action.
countdown-timer.user_impact: Pressures users to consume content or make purchases quickly, often without sufficient consideration.

infinite-scroll.name: Infinite Scroll
infinite-scroll.description: A feed that continuously loads new content as the user scrolls, preventing a natural stopping point.
infinite-scroll.how_to_spot: Endless content without clear pagination or 'end of feed' indicators.
infinite-scroll.user_impact: Contributes to addiction and prolonged usage, making it difficult to disengage from the platform.

fake-notifications.name: Fake Notifications
fake-notifications.description: Notifications designed to create a sense of urgency or social obligation that are not genuinely critical.
fake-notifications.how_to_spot: Frequent, non-essential notifications (e.g., 'Someone you know posted!') that drive app re-engagement.
fake-notifications.user_impact: Drives users back to the app unnecessarily, disrupting focus and increasing screen time.

scarcity-indicators.name: Scarcity Indicators
scarcity-indicators.description: Showing limited stock or time-sensitive deals to create urgency and fear of missing out (FOMO).
scarcity-indicators.how_to_spot: Messages like 'Only 3 left in stock!' or 'Deal ends in 2 hours!' on product pages.
scarcity-indicators.user_impact: Pressures users into making quick purchase decisions without adequate time for consideration, leading to impulse buys.

decoy-pricing.name: Decoy Pricing
decoy-pricing.description: Presenting an intentionally less attractive option to make a target option seem more appealing by comparison.
decoy-pricing.how_to_spot: Subscription tiers where one option is clearly inferior, making a slightly more expensive option seem like a much better value.
decoy-pricing.user_impact: Manipulates perception of value, guiding users towards a specific, often more profitable, choice.

social-obligation.name: Social Obligation
social-obligation.description: Notifications about who viewed your profile or connected with you to encourage reciprocal viewing and engagement.
social-obligation.how_to_spot: Prompts like 'See who viewed your profile' or 'Connect with people you may know' that create a sense of social debt.
social-obligation.user_impact: Creates artificial social pressure and drives engagement based on perceived obligation rather than genuine interest.

fomo-messaging.name: FOMO Messaging
fomo-messaging.description: Messages about missed opportunities or connections to drive engagement and prevent users from leaving.
fomo-messaging.how_to_spot: Notifications like 'You missed an update from X!' or 'Your network is growing, don't miss out!'
fomo-messaging.user_impact: Creates anxiety about missing out on professional or social opportunities, driving continuous platform use.

gaslighting.name: Gaslighting
gaslighting.description: Manipulating someone into questioning their own reality, memory, or sanity, often through denial and contradiction.
gaslighting.how_to_recognize: Constant denial of events you clearly remember, phrases like 'You're crazy,' 'That never happened,' or 'You're too sensitive.'

emotional-blackmail.name: Emotional Blackmail
emotional-blackmail.description: Using emotions like guilt, fear, or obligation to control someone's behavior and decisions.
emotional-blackmail.how_to_recognize: Phrases like 'If you loved me, you would...' or 'After all I've done for you...' to coerce compliance.

love-bombing.name: Love Bombing
love-bombing.description: Overwhelming someone with excessive affection, attention, and flattery to gain control and dependency.
love-bombing.how_to_recognize: Intense, overwhelming attention that feels too good to be true early in a relationship, often followed by sudden withdrawal.

isolation.name: Isolation
isolation.description: Gradually separating someone from their support network (friends, family) to increase dependency on the manipulator.
isolation.how_to_recognize: Discouraging contact with loved ones, creating conflict with your support system, or making you feel guilty for spending time with others.

triangulation.name: Triangulation
triangulation.description: Bringing a third party into a conflict or relationship to manipulate the situation, create jealousy, or avoid direct communication.
triangulation.how_to_recognize: Using others to validate their position, comparing you negatively to others, or creating competition for attention.

silent-treatment.name: Silent Treatment
silent-treatment.description: Withdrawing communication and attention as a form of punishment or control, creating anxiety and a desire for reconciliation.
silent-treatment.how_to_recognize: Refusing to speak, acknowledge, or respond to you for extended periods until you comply with their demands or apologize.

silent-sucker.name: Silent Treatment
silent-sucker.description: Withdrawing communication and attention as a form of punishment or control, creating anxiety and a desire for reconciliation.
silent-sucker.how_to_recognize: Refusing to speak, acknowledge, or respond to you for extended periods until you comply with their demands or apologize.

confirmation-bias.name: Confirmation Bias
confirmation-bias.explanation: The tendency to search for, interpret, favor, and recall information in a way that confirms one's preexisting beliefs.
confirmation-bias.exploitation: Manipulators feed you information that aligns with your views, making their narrative more believable and harder to challenge.
confirmation-bias.example: Only reading news sources that confirm your political views, ignoring contradictory evidence.

anchoring-bias.name: Anchoring Bias
anchoring-bias.explanation: The tendency to rely too heavily on the first piece of information offered (the 'anchor') when making decisions.
anchoring-bias.exploitation: Presenting an extreme initial offer or statement to make subsequent, slightly less extreme offers seem reasonable by comparison.
anchoring-bias.example: A high initial price for a product making a 'discounted' price seem like a good deal, even if the discounted price is still high.

bandwagon-effect.name: Bandwagon Effect
bandwagon-effect.explanation: The tendency to do or believe things because many other people do or believe the same, regardless of personal beliefs.
bandwagon-effect.exploitation: Highlighting popularity ('Millions have tried it!', 'Everyone is doing it!'), creating social pressure to conform.
bandwagon-effect.example: Buying a product just because it's a 'bestseller' or joining a trend because 'everyone else is'.

sunk-cost-fallacy.name: Sunk Cost Fallacy
sunk-cost-fallacy.explanation: The tendency to continue investing in something because of previously invested resources (time, money, effort), even if it's no longer rational.
sunk-cost-fallacy.exploitation: Getting you to invest time or money first, then leveraging that investment to get more, making it hard to quit.
sunk-cost-fallacy.example: Continuing to play a mobile game or watch a bad movie because you've already spent a lot of time/money on it.

availability-heuristic.name: Availability Heuristic
availability-heuristic.explanation: Judging the probability or frequency of an event by how easily examples or instances come to mind.
availability-heuristic.exploitation: Manipulators provide vivid, memorable examples or stories to skew your perception of likelihood or risk.
availability-heuristic.example: Overestimating plane crash risks after seeing news coverage of a crash, while ignoring safer statistics.

authority-bias.name: Authority Bias
authority-bias.explanation: The tendency to attribute greater accuracy and credibility to the opinion of an authority figure, even without expertise.
authority-bias.exploitation: Using fake credentials, titles, or endorsements to appear more credible and influence decisions.
authority-bias.example: Believing health advice from someone in a white coat, regardless of their actual medical qualifications.

forced-continuity.core_tactic_breakdown: Leverages the sunk cost fallacy by automatically extending commitments, making it harder for users to disengage after initial investment.

confirmshaming.core_tactic_breakdown: Exploits social conformity and guilt to coerce users into desired actions, making them feel bad for opting out.

roach-motel.core_tactic_breakdown: Creates high friction for exit, trapping users by making cancellation or disengagement disproportionately difficult compared to entry.

bait-switch.core_tactic_breakdown: Deceives users by presenting an attractive offer (bait) and then substituting it with a less desirable one (switch) once commitment is secured.

hidden-costs.core_tactic_breakdown: Exploits user commitment by revealing additional, often significant, charges only at the very end of the purchasing process.

privacy-zuckering.core_tactic_breakdown: Manipulates users into unknowingly sharing more personal data than intended through confusing interfaces or deceptive defaults.

autoplay-next.core_tactic_breakdown: Automatically progresses content, leveraging inertia and the sunk cost of already watching to keep users engaged for longer periods.

countdown-timer.core_tactic_breakdown: Creates artificial urgency by displaying a limited time frame, pressuring users into immediate decisions to avoid missing out.

infinite-scroll.core_tactic_breakdown: Eliminates natural stopping points, encouraging continuous consumption and making it difficult for users to disengage from the feed.

fake-notifications.core_tactic_breakdown: Deceptively uses notifications to create a false sense of urgency or social importance, driving users back to the app unnecessarily.

scarcity-indicators.core_tactic_breakdown: Highlights limited availability of products or services, triggering fear of missing out and prompting impulsive purchases.

decoy-pricing.core_tactic_breakdown: Introduces a less attractive option to make a desired option appear significantly more appealing and rational by comparison.

social-obligation.core_tactic_breakdown: Leverages social norms and perceived duties to encourage specific actions, such as reciprocating views or connections.

fomo-messaging.core_tactic_breakdown: Creates anxiety about missing out on social or professional opportunities, driving continuous engagement and preventing disengagement.

gaslighting.core_mechanism: Systematically undermines a person's perception of reality, making them doubt their own memory, sanity, or judgment.

emotional-blackmail.core_mechanism: Uses fear, obligation, and guilt (FOG) to manipulate behavior by threatening emotional consequences.

love-bombing.core_mechanism: Overwhelms an individual with excessive positive attention to quickly establish intense emotional dependency and control.

isolation.core_mechanism: Gradually separates an individual from their support system, increasing their reliance on the manipulator and reducing external influence.

triangulation.core_mechanism: Introduces a third party into a two-person dynamic to create conflict, jealousy, or to avoid direct communication and accountability.

silent-treatment.core_mechanism: Withholds communication as a form of punishment, creating anxiety and coercing compliance through emotional deprivation.

confirmation-bias.manipulation_method: Reinforces existing beliefs by selectively presenting or interpreting information, making individuals resistant to contradictory evidence.

anchoring-bias.manipulation_method: Influences decisions by relying heavily on the first piece of information (the 'anchor') encountered, even if irrelevant.

bandwagon-effect.manipulation_method: Encourages conformity by suggesting that 'everyone else is doing it,' leveraging social pressure.

sunk-cost-fallacy.manipulation_method: Compels continued investment in a course of action due to resources already committed, even if it's no longer beneficial.

availability-heuristic.manipulation_method: Skews judgment by making individuals overestimate the likelihood of events that are easily recalled or vivid in memory.

authority-bias.manipulation_method: Leads individuals to overvalue the opinions or instructions of perceived authority figures, regardless of their actual expertise.
